title: 1805-A
statement: A. We Need the Zerotime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThere is an array $$$a$$$ consisting of non-negative integers. You can choose an integer $$$x$$$ and denote $$$b_i=a_i \\oplus x$$$ for all $$$1 \\le i \\le n$$$, where $$$\\oplus$$$ denotes thebitwise XOR operation. Is it possible to choose such a number $$$x$$$ that the value of the expression $$$b_1 \\oplus b_2 \\oplus \\ldots \\oplus b_n$$$ equals $$$0$$$?It can be shown that if a valid number $$$x$$$ exists, then there also exists $$$x$$$ such that ($$$0 \\le x < 2^8$$$).InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 1000$$$). The description of the test cases follows.The first line of the test case contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 10^3$$$) — the length of the array $$$a$$$.The second line of the test case contains $$$n$$$ integers — array $$$a$$$ ($$$0 \\le a_i < 2^8$$$).It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^3$$$.OutputFor each set test case, print the integer $$$x$$$ ($$$0 \\le x < 2^8$$$) if it exists, or $$$-1$$$ otherwise.ExampleInput531 2 531 2 340 1 2 341 2 2 311Output6 0 3 -1 1NoteIn the first test case, after applying the operation with the number $$$6$$$ the array $$$b$$$ becomes $$$[7, 4, 3]$$$, $$$7 \\oplus 4 \\oplus 3 = 0$$$.There are other answers in the third test case, such as the number $$$0$$$.

processed.result:
You are given an array of non-negative integers. You can add a number $x$ to each element of the array using the bitwise XOR operation.  

Is there a number $x$ that you can add to make the sum of all the elements in the array equal to 0? 

If such a number exists, output it. Otherwise, output -1. 

**Input:**

* The first line contains the number of test cases $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains the length of the array $n$.
    * The second line contains $n$ integers, representing the array.

**Output:**

* For each test case, output the number $x$ if it exists, or -1 otherwise.

You are given a list of numbers.  You can add the same number to each number in the list.  Can you find a number to add so that the sum of all the numbers in the list becomes zero? If you can, give the number. If you can't, say -1.
